name: (1E)-N-hydroxy-1-(4,7,7-trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl)propan-1-imine
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-878
Reason: 1-ethylpiperazine-2,3-dione base, with a melting point around 106 degrees Celsius. The presence of two methyl groups reduces the melting point due to the reduced molecular weight and van der Waals interactions, estimated at around -10 degrees Celsius. The trimethylbicyclo[2.2.1]hept-2-yl group introduces a rigid structure with increased molecular weight, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. The hydroxyl group introduces hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +5 degrees Celsius. The propan-1-imine base introduces a basic nitrogen, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius.
